title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 January 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:23 <abusenius> has quit  
00:50 <tekzilla> has quit  
00:55 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
01:05 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki

01:25 <sburjan`> has quit  
01:26 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki

05:18 <DrLou> has quit

09:39 <vmassol> sburjan`: fyi I've just documented the AllDocs and SpaceIndex pages at http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Index+Application  
09:39 <vmassol> sburjan`: I couldn't find it documented anywhere else. Do you know if it's elsewhere too?  
09:40 <CIA-32> Marius Dumitru Florea xwiki-commons-3.4 \* r3b461e0 / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-commons-3.4 - http://git.io/mfbQzQ  
09:40 <CIA-32> Marius Dumitru Florea xwiki-commons-3.4 \* rfa35b67 / (31 files in 31 dirs): [maven-release-plugin] prepare release xwiki-commons-3.4 - http://git.io/67rCHg  
09:41 <CIA-32> Vincent Massol master \* ra3e969e / pom.xml : [Misc] Upgrade to javadoc maven plugin v2.8.1 - http://git.io/5QMH6A  
09:41 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <vmassol> mflorea: are you ok that I update the maven release plugin version from 2.2.1 to 2.2.2 (on master)?  
09:43 <+mflorea> go ahead  
09:43 <vmassol> XCOMMONS-79  
09:47 <vmassol> mflorea: I'm going to also upgrade the surefire plugin if you're ok to 2.11  
09:47 <vmassol> there's one item that says:  
09:47 <vmassol> " \* [SUREFIRE-508] - cannot run GWTTestCases with surefire"  
09:47 <+mflorea> ok  
09:48 <+mflorea> I'll have to try this  
09:48 <vmassol> we're using GWTTestCase right?  
09:48 <+mflorea> yep  
09:48 <+mflorea> and test special goal of GWT maven plugin  
09:49 <+mflorea> I'll see how it works with surefire  
09:49 <vmassol> quite a few things in 2.11: XCOMMONS-81  
09:50 <CIA-32> Marius Dumitru Florea xwiki-rendering-3.4 \* r8671428 / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-rendering-3.4 - http://git.io/f8v2Sg  
09:50 <CIA-32> Marius Dumitru Florea xwiki-rendering-3.4 \* re2e00bc / (26 files in 26 dirs): [maven-release-plugin] prepare release xwiki-rendering-3.4 - http://git.io/LlC6FQ  
09:56 <CIA-32> Vincent Massol master \* r1a2d6b8 / pom.xml : XCOMMONS-79: Upgrade Maven Release plugin to 2.2.2 - http://git.io/9WOucA  
09:56 <CIA-32> Vincent Massol master \* r86a7c49 / pom.xml : XCOMMONS-80: Upgrade to Maven Dependency Plugin 2.4 - http://git.io/nKV06g  
09:56 <CIA-32> Vincent Massol master \* rcc20a87 / pom.xml : XCOMMONS-81: Upgrade Maven Surefire Plugin to 2.11 - http://git.io/KS-iTw  
09:56 <CIA-32> Vincent Massol master \* rc640c7b / pom.xml : XCOMMONS-82: Upgrade Maven Assembly Plugin to 2.2.2 - http://git.io/jTxCfQ  
09:57 <+mflorea> vmassol: no luck with the functional-test-lifecycle extensio http://pastebin.com/FfzugSDS  
09:58 <vmassol> mflorea: hmm I think I fixed it only on master right?  
09:58 <+mflorea> ah, ok  
09:58 <vmassol> if you want I can make the same change on 3.4 branch  
09:58 <+mflorea> it's ok, I will build locally  
09:59 <vmassol> ok  
09:59 <vmassol> note: I'm not completely sure I fixed it though (even on master) but I couldn't make it fail locally when it was failing before  
10:06 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <CIA-32> tmortagne master \* rcd1d807 / pom.xml : XCOMMONS-84: Indicate version of httpclient 4.x to use - http://git.io/uY0\_gw  
10:42 <CIA-32> tmortagne master \* r37c3e4a / (3 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7417: Upgrade XWiki Repository handler to httpclient 4.x - http://git.io/jGEGTA  
11:10 <n4nd0> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <n4nd0> hi  
11:10 <n4nd0> how can I read past conversations in IRC chat?  
11:11 <+tmortagne> n4nd0: on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/  
11:11 <+tmortagne> everything is archived on xwikki.org  
11:12 <+tmortagne> s/xwikki/xwiki/  
11:13 <n4nd0> all right  
11:13 <n4nd0> but, is there something more general which should work with other channels?  
11:13 <+tmortagne> google ? :)  
11:16 <vmassol> n4nd0: see dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/MailingLists  
11:16 <vmassol> (you'll find links to search/archives)  
11:17 <+tmortagne> n4nd0: or do you mean search in different URC channels ?  
11:17 <+tmortagne> IRC  
11:17 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:18 <n4nd0> tmortagne: exactly  
11:18 <+tmortagne> I don't know how to search on a IRC server across channels  
11:18 <vmassol> there isn't  
11:18 <+tmortagne> not sure it's possible in IRC protocol, maybe some server provide interface for it  
11:19 <n4nd0> ok  
11:19 <vmassol> http://www.irclog.org/network.php?net=freenode  
11:19 <vmassol> you'll find stuff like this but it's far from complete  
11:19 <vmassol> and it's up to each project to save the irc logs if they want to  
11:19 <n4nd0> but that was sort of what I was looking for  
11:19 <n4nd0> thank you very much  
11:19 <vmassol> you won't find much there  
11:20 <vmassol> another one: http://irclogger.com/  
11:24 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
11:29 <sdumitriu> has quit  
11:30 <CIA-32> tmortagne master \* r63ae149 / pom.xml : Upgrade to 3.5 - http://git.io/LKeV8w  
11:48 <fmancinelli> has quit  
12:30 <vmassol> mflorea: I'm trying to use the office macro  
12:30 <+mflorea> and?  
12:30 <vmassol> and I get a stack trace ending with:  
12:30 <vmassol> Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException  
12:30 <vmassol> at org.xwiki.officeimporter.internal.builder.DefaultPresentationBuilder.importPresentation(DefaultPresentationBuilder.java:142)  
12:30 <vmassol> I guess I'll need openoffice to run right?  
12:30 <+mflorea> do you have the office server connected?  
12:31 <+mflorea> yes, you need it  
12:31 <vmassol> stil I'm surprised to see a NPE. I was expecting a message telling me that I need openoffice to run  
12:31 <vmassol> \*still  
12:31 <+mflorea> yes, Anca reported this  
12:31 <+mflorea> it's in jira  
12:31 <vmassol> ok good then  
12:31 <vmassol> it's really not intuitive now  
12:46 <n4nd0> has quit  
12:51 <vmassol> mflorea: how do I control the size of the generated images?  
12:51 <vmassol> the default seems to be 800x600  
12:51 <+mflorea> from configuration  
12:52 <vmassol> reading doc  
12:53 <vmassol> hmm can't find it in http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Office+Macro  
12:54 <vmassol> is it an xwiki configuration?  
12:54 <+mflorea> no, it's jodconverter configuration  
12:55 <+mflorea> I remember asking someone to document this.. it seems he didn't do it..  
13:01 <vmassol> mflorea: my use case is to attach an ODT file, use the office macro and make it full screen (and make my browser full screen) to be able to only see the presentation displayed on a project  
13:01 <vmassol> s/project/projector  
13:02 <vmassol> right now I get a small image centered on the screen with a lot of black around it  
13:02 <+mflorea> give me a few minutes to document this  
13:02 <vmassol> it seems we're close but not quite there for this use case  
13:02 <vmassol> ok  
13:03 <vmassol> to make it better we would need to add an office macro param to control the size of generated images  
13:03 <vmassol> can the jodconverter param be passed when we parse the input?  
13:05 <+mflorea> last time I checked no. you have to write custom code that uses the office undocumented API.  
13:05 <vmassol> in any case even that would not be perfect  
13:06 <vmassol> since the size depends on the viewer screen  
13:06 <vmassol> and thus it shouldn't be controlled by the content  
13:06 <vmassol> this is hard....  
13:07 <vmassol> only solution I can think of is large image generation and downscaling to fit screen but that's not perfect either  
13:07 <vmassol> maybe we could start by using a default export of 1024x768  
13:07 <vmassol> since this is the resolution we target by default  
13:08 <vmassol> we can project on projectors using a 1024x768 resolution, it's probably acceptable  
13:08 <vmassol> (as a default)  
13:15 <+mflorea> vmassol: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Office+Macro#HConfiguration  
13:16 <vmassol> mflorea: thanks  
13:16 <vmassol> so wdyt about using 1024x76 by default for us?  
13:17 <vmassol> we'd need a simpler way than copy the whole file though  
13:17 <CIA-32> Denis Gervalle feature-security-authorization \* rdd11d1e / (29 files in 9 dirs): New SecurityAccess, replace and improve AccessLevel to support many more rights (up to 64). ...  
13:17 <CIA-32> Denis Gervalle feature-security-authorization \* r25c2225 / (13 files in 8 dirs): Improve some unit tests: better coverage, better mocking, better code style, less dependencies ...  
13:18 <+mflorea> I'm fine with 1024 as default width. I don't know how to configure it without copying the entire file.  
13:22 <+mflorea> vmassol: I've added a new note regarding image quality/compression http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Office+Macro#HConfiguration . Might be useful in your case, if you want the images to look good.  
13:23 <vmassol> thanks  
13:23 <vmassol> what's the default quality?  
13:23 <vmassol> (if I don't use "90")  
13:25 <+mflorea> I don't remember. Note that these params are passed directly to office server and thus are specific to the office server conversion filters. I searched a while ago for a way to control the image quality on the open office docs, but I don't remember what is the default value. Open Office documentation is a bit cryptic..  
13:26 <vmassol> k… we'll also need to improve the wait for the first time generation with some progress bar  
13:26 <+mflorea> I'm even sure I found this in their docs. Could have been just an example on some forum  
13:26 <vmassol> I'm viewing a 5 slides ODT and it's taking several minutes  
13:27 <vmassol> actually it failed now :(  
13:27 <vmassol> with the new export size  
13:27 <+mflorea> hmm, I didn't take that long to me ever  
13:27 <vmassol> "Caused by: org.artofsolving.jodconverter.office.OfficeException: task did not complete within timeout  
13:27 <vmassol> "  
13:27 <vmassol> Caused by: java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException  
13:27 <vmassol> at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerGet(FutureTask.java:228)  
13:27 <vmassol> at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:91)  
13:27 <vmassol> at org.artofsolving.jodconverter.office.PooledOfficeManager.execute(PooledOfficeManager.java:85)  
13:28 <+mflorea> yes, jodconverter timesout because it take too long for the office server to make the conversion  
13:30 <vmassol> ok I'm stopping this idea  
13:30 <vmassol> it's not working well enough  
13:30 <vmassol> thanks for the help mflorea  
13:31 <vmassol> however this means this openoffice feature is not good enough for production use right now, we'll need to work on that at some point...  
13:34 <+mflorea> vmassol: with a 3.5-SNAPSHOT I can view a 12 slide presentation in 3 seconds locally, with Quality 90 and width 1024px..  
13:35 <vmassol> I'm on 3.5-SNAPSHOT too  
13:35 <+mflorea> what office server are you using?  
13:35 <vmassol> libreoffice  
13:35 <+mflorea> I'm using libre office 3.4.4  
13:35 <vmassol> checking version  
13:36 <+mflorea> LibreOffice 3.4.4  OOO340m1 (Build:402)  
13:36 <vmassol> 3.4.2  
13:36 <+mflorea> I doubt this is the problem.  
13:36 <vmassol> I doubt it too  
13:37 <vmassol> I have several images in my presentation  
13:37 <+mflorea> I have only text  
13:37 <+mflorea> let me try another presentation  
13:37 <vmassol> 283K it's not that big  
13:37 <+mflorea> (well, only text and the XWiki logo)  
13:39 <+mflorea> I have a wiki30 presentation made by Fabio that has enough images, and still I can view it in a few seconds.  
13:39 <+mflorea> and it has 2.4Mb  
13:39 <+mflorea> 19 slides  
13:41 <vmassol> a few second is for the first generation or when using the cache?  
13:42 <+mflorea> first time  
13:49 <CIA-32> Marius Dumitru Florea xwiki-platform-3.4 \* r1643178 / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-platform-3.4 - http://git.io/luEDFw  
13:49 <CIA-32> Marius Dumitru Florea xwiki-platform-3.4 \* r6eb188e / (194 files in 194 dirs): [maven-release-plugin] prepare release xwiki-platform-3.4 - http://git.io/wRpUOQ  
13:58 <kayasaman> has quit  
13:59 <vmassol> mflorea: Ive installed libreoffice 3.4.5  
13:59 <+mflorea> and?  
13:59 <vmassol> It's a bit better, took 25 seconds this time  
13:59 <+mflorea> :)  
13:59 <vmassol> I get my 1024 images now, cool  
14:00 <+mflorea> have you tried other presentations? maybe it has something to do with the content of that particular presentation  
14:00 <vmassol> if you give me the link to the one you're using I can try it  
14:01 <+mflorea> I'm not sure where it is published. I'll send you an email  
14:02 <kayasaman> has joined #xwiki  
14:03 <+mflorea> done  
14:05 <vmassol> mflorea: thanks, which one, the odp one?  
14:05 <+mflorea> the ppt one has images, 19 slides  
14:05 <+mflorea> that is Fabios's  
14:06 <vmassol> 11 seconds for the ODP one  
14:07 <vmassol> 26 for the PPT one  
14:08 <vmassol> defaulting to 1024x768 would be a great improvement IMO  
14:08 <+mflorea> pretty long. I don't know why it takes longer on your machine  
14:08 <+mflorea> yes, I agree  
14:08 <vmassol> I'm on mac  
14:08 <+mflorea> the quick solution is to pacakge a custom document-formats.js in WEB-INF/classes  
14:09 <vmassol> openoffice was horrible on mac  
14:09 <vmassol> libreoffice is a bit better  
14:09 <vmassol> but I still find it slow in general  
14:09 <+mflorea> maybe that's the reason. Could be that libreoffice is better integrated in linux/ubuntu, I don't know  
14:09 <vmassol> they've probably improved the speed a bit with version 3.4.5 compared to 3.4.2 that I was using  
14:10 <vmassol> creating a jira issue  
14:12 <CIA-32> Marius Dumitru Florea xwiki-enterprise-3.4 \* rae3f516 / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-enterprise-3.4 - http://git.io/xiJbDA  
14:12 <CIA-32> Marius Dumitru Florea xwiki-enterprise-3.4 \* r2e9cf91 / (40 files in 40 dirs): [maven-release-plugin] prepare release xwiki-enterprise-3.4 - http://git.io/b7-maw  
14:13 <vmassol> XWIKI-7432  
14:22 <CIA-32> Marius Dumitru Florea xwiki-manager-3.4 \* ree8a57c / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-manager-3.4 - http://git.io/fe7PIQ  
14:22 <CIA-32> Marius Dumitru Florea xwiki-manager-3.4 \* r555df8d / (17 files in 17 dirs): [maven-release-plugin] prepare release xwiki-manager-3.4 - http://git.io/r7siZg  
14:27 <vmassol> Enygma`: it would be great to have better screenshots for http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Workspace+Application When I look at this page I don't feel it gives justice to this feature. WDYT?  
14:27 <vmassol> (I need to get some screenshots for "workspaces" for a presentation and I was looking there but they're not good enough)  
14:28 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:28 <vmassol> (I thought you said you were redoing the screenshots btw)  
14:31 <+mflorea> vmassol: platform build is failing, and Jenkins indicates "[Misc] Upgrade to javadoc maven plugin v2.8.1" as the cause, but might be something else  
14:32 <+mflorea> well, this says something else http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/1412/console tmortagne I think it's related to the httpclient upgrade  
14:36 <vmassol> hehe… hot potatoe swapping  
14:37 <+tmortagne> mflorea: yes I have seen it but it does not make sense the dependency version is in http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/commons/xwiki-commons/3.5-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-commons-3.5-20120124.093814-5.pom  
14:38 <+mflorea> then let's rebuild commons  
14:38 <+tmortagne> well it has to build well to be deployed on http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/commons/xwiki-commons/3.5-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-commons-3.5-20120124.093814-5.pom  
14:38 <+tmortagne> ss/has/had/  
14:39 <+mflorea> ah, right  
14:39 <+tmortagne> I checked and the -U is there so I don't understand why platform does not use the proper commons pom (only way to not find the dependency version)  
14:40 <+tmortagne> the platform parent is right too  
14:40 <+tmortagne> so i don't think it's using commons 3.4  
14:40 <+tmortagne> hmm did not checked rendering  
14:40 <+tmortagne> but that would not change anything  
14:40 <+tmortagne> platform parent is commons  
14:41 <+tmortagne> it's not a type since it's building well on my side, can you try to build platform with -U on your side ?  
14:41 <+tmortagne> s:type/typo/  
14:42 <+tmortagne> will check the commons pom in the agent local repository  
14:43 <kayasaman> hi guys has anyone got an update on when this page will be fixed http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Skins ??  
14:43 <+tmortagne> vmassol: btw the option seems to work well, see http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/  
14:44 <+tmortagne> "(pending -                 Upstream project xwiki-rendering is already building.               )"  
14:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: ah cool :)  
14:45 <+tmortagne> mflorea: seems to build well on agent-1  
14:46 <+tmortagne> I just deleted the ~/.m2/repository/org/xwiki/commons/xwiki-commons on agent-2, will see next time it try to build on it  
14:46 <+mflorea> platform root pom builds fine on my machine too  
14:47 <+tmortagne> make me think we should upgrade maven to 3.0.4 on agents  
14:49 <+tmortagne> btw who is the build manager ?  
14:50 <+tmortagne> mflorea: I see you did the last two weeks according to http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/BuildManagerRoster, you love it that much ? :)  
14:50 <+mflorea> no :), but since I was the release manager I had to take care of the build to  
14:50 <vmassol> there was noone else and marius kindly volunteered because someone had to do the job  
14:51 <+tmortagne> will do this week then  
14:51 <+mflorea> I'm plan to be build manager today too, and maybe tomorrow because I have to fix some tests on FF3.6  
14:51 <+mflorea> then I'll hand over the job :)  
14:52 <+tmortagne> mflorea: you don't have to be build manager to even think of ci either or fix tests  
14:52 <+mflorea> tmortagne: ok, I'll help with the test failing on FF3.6 (today or tomorrow)  
14:54 <+tmortagne> mflorea: what is the state of 3.4 branch ? if I commit something will it be in 3.4 or 3.4.1 ?  
14:55 <+mflorea> 3.4 is already out  
14:55 <+mflorea> I'm not sure there will be a 3.4.1. We need to decide.  
14:55 <+mflorea> since 3.4 and 3.5 are stabilization releases  
14:55 <+tmortagne> yea  
14:56 <+mflorea> they are short, and you can wait for 3.5 is you have a bug in 3.4  
14:57 <CIA-32> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r4bbd893 / pom.xml : Update clirr.previous.version after we released 3.4. - http://git.io/erPfvA  
14:58 <CIA-32> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r54f5cc0 / xwiki-platform-core/pom.xml : Remove clirr excludes for 3.4 version. - http://git.io/W7jv3g  
15:06 <DrLou\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:42 <vmassol> mflorea: i got another timeout on the same doc  
15:42 <vmassol> so it seems to really depend  
15:43 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
15:43 <vmassol> mflorea: btw I've just tried to import a PDF and it failed….seems a rendering wikimodel issue...  
15:43 <vmassol> opening an issue for that  
15:43 <+mflorea> re timeout, yes.. :( but unfortunately we depend on the office server, so I don't think we can do much if it's slow.  
15:43 <+mflorea> nop  
15:43 <+mflorea> wait
